content.description: Start on the jug and feet out right. Goes straight up on bad slopers. Gets slick in the sun, plan accordingly.

Start on a left sidepull and right sloper. Traverse left with an undercling and make a reachy move to a prominent sidepull jug. Move up and left on slopers to a solid top out.

Beta Vid
Walk up the slabby right-hand face of the boulder. Easy, a good place for new outdoor boulderers to build confidence and practice footwork.
content.protection: Lowball boulder, nice flat landing for a pad. Your greatest danger will be dodging bike traffic!

content.description: Stand start with left hand on a crimp at head height and right hand on a low undercling around waist height. Smear feet and climb up. Traditionally the undercling rails used on The Squeaky Hinge are off.Â
content.protection: A pad and maybe a spotter
content.location: This is in the middle of the face of the boulder that is directly on the path. It is in between Straight Up and The Squeaky Hinge.

content.description: Start standing with a left hand side pull and a bad right hand sloper. Climb the slab up and slightly to the left. The footwork is important.
content.protection: A pad and maybe a spotter
content.location: This starts in the middle of the face of the boulder that is directly on the path. Just a foot left of Straight Up.

content.description:
A boulder with routes and eliminates.  

  It's easy to notice from the path since the rock is lighter in color than most around it. In the growing season bright green vines on the edge highlight it even more. 

  Classics include: The Slab - V0. 

  There are obvious steep, short sit down start problems on the left side of the boulder. 

  There are five major lines up to V8, plus variations.
